answers.answer: Hi hon!!  I recognized your name!  =D  I am soooooo glad that I was able to help!  Thank you so much for the updates.  I know that diabetes is very intimidating to deal with, but to make it more "dealable" do as much research as you can.  Once you arm yourself with information, you'll feel so much better and more confident in dealing with this condition!  Once you get your baby's condition is under control, he'll feel so much better and you'll have many many more years to love him!  =DIf there's any more info that you need, you can write to me ANY time.  Send me a personal message, too if you want!Take care and give kitty a belly rub for me!Lots of hugs!

I will start today to read all I can about this illness. I gave her her first shot today. It was kind of scary but we got through it and I am sure it will get better as I learn. Thank you so much for your excellent help and thank you for letting me know I can email you if I have any questions. You saved my baby's life!!!!!!!! And I will be forever grateful!!!!!

You're a very welcome.  I was glad to help!!!!  I can imagine how intimidating it would be to have to deal with injections...very overwhelming!!  I bet that a lot of other people, including myself, would feel the exact same way!  Once you get used to the needles for the first week or two, I know you'll start to feel better AND more confident.  It'll just take a lot of getting used to!  Take each day as it comes, and you'll be just fine!!You're a great mom to your kitty, and he's very lucky to have you!  =D  I've heard of too many people deciding to put their cats to sleep because they didn't want to deal with their pets diabetes.  So, your willingness to take care of your baby with this disease, says sooooooo much about you!Remember, take care, take each day as it comes.....and you'll be just fine!!  =D

I have a 4month old kitten and she has a growth on her neck she has scratch it untill it turned red  when i got her it was there but very small and she didn't scratch at it at all can you tell me what this could be

question: I just wanted to tell you how grateful I am for your help. On Feb. 23rd. I posted a question about my cat and you told me it sounded like diabetes and to get her to a Vet. I did and starting tomorrow she will start insulin injections. It is kind of scary but you helped me a lot.My cat is my baby and I appreciate your help more then you will ever know.Thank youDarlene
title: For Zodiacqueen
